Fungal infection.description: A common skin condition caused by fungi, often resulting in redness and itching.
Fungal infection.advice: Keep the area dry and clean. Use antifungal cream. Consult a dermatologist if needed.

Allergy.description: A hypersensitive immune response to allergens such as pollen, dust, or food.
Allergy.advice: Avoid known allergens. Use antihistamines. Seek medical help for severe reactions.

GERD.description: A chronic digestive disorder where stomach acid irritates the food pipe lining.
GERD.advice: Avoid spicy foods, donâ€™t lie down after meals. Use antacids. Consult a gastroenterologist.

Chronic cholestasis.description: A liver condition where bile cannot flow from the liver to the duodenum.
Chronic cholestasis.advice: Maintain a healthy liver diet. Avoid alcohol. Consult a hepatologist.

Drug Reaction.advice: Stop the suspected drug immediately. Consult a doctor urgently.

Peptic ulcer disease.description: Open sores on the inner lining of the stomach or small intestine.
Peptic ulcer disease.advice: Avoid NSAIDs and spicy foods. Use antacids. Visit a gastroenterologist.

AIDS.description: Acquired Immunodeficiency Syndrome caused by HIV.
AIDS.advice: Follow antiretroviral therapy (ART) strictly. Maintain hygiene and regular health checks.

Diabetes.description: A metabolic disorder causing high blood sugar levels.
Diabetes.advice: Monitor blood glucose. Follow a diabetic diet. Exercise and take medications as prescribed.

Gastroenteritis.description: Inflammation of the stomach and intestines caused by infection.
Gastroenteritis.advice: Stay hydrated. Take ORS. Consult a doctor if symptoms persist.

Bronchial Asthma.description: A respiratory condition marked by spasms in the bronchi.
Bronchial Asthma.advice: Avoid allergens. Use prescribed inhalers. Monitor breathing regularly.

Hypertension.description: High blood pressure often without symptoms.
Hypertension.advice: Reduce salt, exercise regularly, and take medication if prescribed.

Migraine.description: Recurring headaches with nausea and sensitivity to light or sound.
Migraine.advice: Avoid triggers. Use pain relievers and migraine-specific medications.

Cervical spondylosis.description: Age-related wear and tear affecting spinal disks in the neck.
Cervical spondylosis.advice: Do neck exercises. Maintain good posture. Use neck collars if advised.

Paralysis (brain hemorrhage).description: Loss of muscle function due to bleeding in the brain.
Paralysis (brain hemorrhage).advice: Seek immediate medical attention. Long-term physiotherapy is essential.

Jaundice.description: Yellowing of the skin due to high bilirubin levels.
Jaundice.advice: Avoid alcohol. Eat a liver-friendly diet. Consult a doctor for liver function tests.

Malaria.description: A mosquito-borne infectious disease causing fever and chills.
Malaria.advice: Use mosquito nets. Take antimalarial drugs. Get a blood test for confirmation.

Chickenpox.description: A viral infection causing itchy blisters all over the body.
Chickenpox.advice: Isolate the patient. Use calamine lotion. Avoid scratching.

Dengue.description: A mosquito-borne viral infection with high fever and bleeding tendencies.
Dengue.advice: Stay hydrated. Monitor platelets. Hospitalize if needed.

Typhoid.description: A bacterial infection due to Salmonella typhi causing prolonged fever.
Typhoid.advice: Take antibiotics. Eat a soft diet. Avoid street food.

Hepatitis A.description: Liver infection caused by Hepatitis A virus, often through contaminated food or water.
Hepatitis A.advice: Rest, hydrate well, and maintain good hygiene.

Hepatitis B.description: Serious liver infection caused by Hepatitis B virus.
Hepatitis B.advice: Antiviral medications and regular liver monitoring. Avoid alcohol.

Hepatitis C.description: Liver disease caused by the Hepatitis C virus.
Hepatitis C.advice: Seek antiviral treatment. Avoid sharing personal hygiene tools.

Hepatitis D.description: A liver infection that occurs only in people infected with Hepatitis B.
Hepatitis D.advice: Get Hepatitis B vaccinated. Consult a hepatologist.

Hepatitis E.description: Waterborne liver infection due to contaminated water.
Hepatitis E.advice: Drink clean water. Rest. Consult a physician.

Alcoholic hepatitis.description: Liver inflammation due to excessive alcohol intake.
Alcoholic hepatitis.advice: Stop drinking. Follow liver-friendly diet. Medical treatment required.

Tuberculosis.description: Bacterial infection that primarily affects the lungs.
Tuberculosis.advice: Take full course of antibiotics. Isolate if active TB is diagnosed.

Common Cold.description: Viral infection causing runny nose, cough, and sore throat.
Common Cold.advice: Rest, stay hydrated, and take over-the-counter medication.

Pneumonia.description: Infection that inflames air sacs in the lungs.
Pneumonia.advice: Take antibiotics or antivirals as prescribed. Rest well.

Dimorphic hemorrhoids.description: Swollen veins in the lower rectum causing pain and bleeding.
Dimorphic hemorrhoids.advice: Eat high-fiber foods. Use topical creams. Seek surgical options if severe.

Heart attack.description: Blockage of blood flow to the heart muscle.
Heart attack.advice: Seek emergency medical help. Take aspirin if advised.

Varicose veins.description: Enlarged, swollen veins often in the legs.
Varicose veins.advice: Wear compression stockings. Avoid long standing. Seek surgical options if required.

Hypothyroidism.advice: Take prescribed thyroid hormones. Monitor thyroid levels regularly.

Hyperthyroidism.advice: Antithyroid medications. Consider radioactive iodine or surgery.

Hypoglycemia.advice: Eat glucose tablets or sugary food immediately. Monitor glucose levels regularly.

Osteoarthristis.description: Joint inflammation causing pain and stiffness.
Osteoarthristis.advice: Maintain weight. Do physiotherapy. Use pain relievers.

Arthritis.description: Inflammation of joints causing pain and limited movement.
Arthritis.advice: Use anti-inflammatory medications. Do regular exercise.

Vertigo.description: A sensation of spinning or losing balance.
Vertigo.advice: Avoid sudden head movements. Take prescribed vertigo medications.

Acne.description: Skin condition with pimples, blackheads, and inflammation.
Acne.advice: Clean skin gently. Avoid oily products. Consult a dermatologist if severe.

Urinary tract infection.description: Infection in urinary system causing painful urination.
Urinary tract infection.advice: Drink plenty of fluids. Take antibiotics after doctor consultation.

Psoriasis.description: Autoimmune skin disease causing red, scaly patches.
Psoriasis.advice: Moisturize regularly. Use medicated creams. Avoid triggers.

Impetigo.description: Contagious skin infection with red sores and blisters.
Impetigo.advice: Maintain hygiene. Use prescribed antibiotics or creams.
